detailedSummary: React Router enables single-page applications (SPAs) with client-side routing, allowing navigation without page reloads. React Router uses BrowserRouter to enable routing. Routes define URL-to-component mappings using Route components. Link components create navigation links that don't reload the page. useNavigate hook programmatically navigates. useParams extracts URL parameters. useLocation accesses current location. useSearchParams handles query strings. Nested routes create hierarchical navigation. Protected routes require authentication. Route guards redirect unauthorized users. Dynamic routes use parameters (:id). 404 pages handle unknown routes. Navigation guards prevent navigation under certain conditions. Understanding React Router enables building multi-page applications with smooth navigation and proper URL management.
whyItMatters: React Router is essential for building multi-page React applications - it enables navigation, URL management, and proper routing without page reloads, which is standard in modern web apps.

assignments.title: Build a Multi-Page React App with Routing
assignments.description: Create a React application with multiple pages and navigation using React Router.
tasks: Set up React Router in a React application
Create multiple routes for different pages
Implement navigation using Link components and useNavigate hook
Use URL parameters and query strings to pass data between routes
Build a complete multi-page application with protected routes and 404 handling

quizzes.question: What is the main advantage of React Router over traditional page navigation?
options: It enables client-side routing without page reloads
quizzes.explanation: React Router enables client-side routing, allowing navigation between pages without full page reloads, creating faster, smoother user experiences.

quizzes.question: Link components in React Router cause full page reloads like regular anchor tags.
quizzes.explanation: False. Link components in React Router perform client-side navigation without page reloads, maintaining application state and providing faster transitions.

quizzes.question: What does useParams hook do?
options: Extracts URL parameters from the current route
quizzes.explanation: useParams extracts URL parameters (like :id in /users/:id) from the current route, allowing components to access dynamic route data.
